summary: Oliver J. Champion was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents provided are payroll certifications listing Champion's name, position, and salary for the accounting periods of October 1977, November 1977, and May 1978. These documents indicate that Champion was a staff member of the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: Oliver J. Champion's significance lies in their employment with the HSCA, the committee tasked with reinvestigating the JFK assassination. While the specific role Champion played within the committee is not detailed in these documents, their presence on the payroll indicates their involvement in the HSCA's operations during a portion of its investigation.
